Virtuous ones!

In this way, one is defiled by defiled conduct, dwells in the knot of not speaking, deceives and flatters, is stingy and jealous, has no shame or conscience, has an angry and evil mind, speaks words of anger and scolding, scolds bhiká¹£us, despises bhiká¹£us, exposes bhiká¹£us, avoids each other and speaks of external matters, does not speak, is angry, and has intense hatred, has evil friends and companions, is ungrateful and does not know gratitude.

Bhikshus, you should reflect on this.

Monks, contemplating in this way, one who is not ungrateful and knows gratitude should train like this.

If a monk contemplates in this way, he will greatly benefit. Do I have evil desires and think of desires, or do I not have evil desires and not think of desires?

if a person with eyes sees a face without dirt, he will be delighted, thinking, 'My face is clean, that is why I am delighted.'
Venerable friends,
if a monk, when contemplating, knows that he practices evil desires and thinks of desires, he will not be delighted, but will seek to abandon them.
Venerable friends,

if a monk, when contemplating, knows that he does not practice evil desires and does not think of desires, he will be delighted, thinking, 'I am pure, and seek to learn the noble Dharma,' that is why he is delighted.

Cunda!

Zhou Na!

Zhou Na!

If others have lack of faith, laziness, lack of mindfulness, lack of concentration, and evil wisdom, I have no evil wisdom, I should learn to gradually reduce.

If one only gives rise to the mind and wishes to seek and learn wholesome dharmas, then one will benefit much, let alone practicing wholesome dharmas with body and speech?

Sutra on the Parable of the Blue and White Lotus Flowers (92), Chapter 6, Section on Impurity, Middle Length Ä€gama, Sutra on the Parable of the Blue and White Lotus Flowers, Second Recitation at a Small Earth Fortress I have heard thus:
Once, when the Buddha was traveling in the country of Shravasti, he was staying in the Jeta Grove, Anathapindika's Park.
At that time, the World-Honored One told the bhikshus:
There are dharmas that are extinguished through the body, not through speech;
there are dharmas that are extinguished through speech, not through the body;
there are dharmas that are not extinguished through the body or speech, but are extinguished through the wisdom-eye.
What are the dharmas that are extinguished through the body, not through speech?
A bhikshu may be full of unwholesome bodily actions, completely upholding and attaching to them. When other bhikshus see this, they rebuke that bhikshu:
'Virtuous one!
Why do you fully uphold and attach to unwholesome bodily actions?
Virtuous one!
You should abandon unwholesome bodily actions and cultivate wholesome bodily actions.
Later, he abandoned unwholesome bodily actions and cultivated wholesome bodily actions. This is called a dharma that ceases from the body, not from speech.
What is a dharma that ceases from speech, not from the body?
A bhiká¹£u is filled with unwholesome verbal actions, fully upholding and adhering to them. The other bhiká¹£us, having seen this, rebuke that bhiká¹£u:
'Venerable one!
You are filled with unwholesome verbal actions, fully upholding and adhering to them. Why do you cling to them?
Venerable one!
You should abandon unwholesome verbal actions and cultivate wholesome verbal actions.
Later, he abandoned unwholesome verbal actions and cultivated wholesome verbal actions. This is called a dharma that ceases from speech, not from the body.
What is a dharma that does not cease from body or speech, but ceases through the insight of wisdom?

The increase of investigation does not cease from body and speech, but only ceases with wisdom. In the same way, disputes, resentment, hatred, entanglements, bonds, stinginess, jealousy, deceit, flattery, shamelessness, lack of conscience, evil desires, and evil views do not cease from body and speech, but only cease with wisdom.
These are called dharmas that do not cease from body and speech, but only cease with wisdom.

The TathÄgata sometimes observes the minds of others and knows that this person does not cultivate the body, cultivate precepts, cultivate the mind, or cultivate wisdom in this way, and by cultivating the body, cultivating precepts, cultivating the mind, and cultivating wisdom, attains the cessation of the increase of investigation.
Why is it so?

Because this person's mind gives rise to evil investigation and abides there, in the same way, disputes, resentment, hatred, entanglements, bonds, stinginess, jealousy, deceit, flattery, shamelessness, lack of conscience, evil desires, and evil views attain the cessation of evil.
Why is it so?
Because this person's mind abides in evil desires and evil views.
